t: Luke 1
Forasmuch*p as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us,
Even*p as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;
It*p seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,
That*p thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.
There*p was in the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the course of Abia: and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elisabeth.
And*p they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
And*p they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both were now well stricken in years.
And*p it came to pass, that while he executed the priest's office before God in the order of his course,
According*p to the custom of the priest's office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord.
And*p the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.
And*p there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.
And*p when Zacharias saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.
But*p the angel said unto him, Fear not, Zacharias: for thy prayer is heard; and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John.
And*p thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.
For*p he shall be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother's womb.
And*p many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.

And*p he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.
And*p Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.
And*p the angel answering said unto him, I am Gabriel, that stand in the presence of God; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew thee these glad tidings.
And,*p behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.
And*p the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.
And*p when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned unto them, and remained speechless.
And*p it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.
And*p after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,
Thus*p hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me, to take away my reproach among men.
And*p in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God unto a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,
To*p a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin's name was Mary.
And*p the angel came in unto her, and said, Hail, thou that art highly favoured, the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women.
And*p when she saw him, she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.
And*p the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.
And,*p behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.
He*p shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:
And*p he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.
Then*p said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

And*p the angel answered and said unto her, The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the Highest shall overshadow thee: therefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.
And,*p behold, thy cousin Elisabeth, she hath also conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her, who was called barren.
For*p with God nothing shall be impossible.
And*p Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.
And*p Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;
And*p entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.
And*p it came to pass, that, when Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost:
And*p she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.
And*p whence is this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
For,*p lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.
And*p blessed is she that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.
And*p Mary said, My soul doth magnify the Lord,
And*p my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.
For*p he hath regarded the low estate of his handmaiden: for, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.
For*p he that is mighty hath done to me great things; and holy is his name.
And*p his mercy is on them that fear him from generation to generation.
He*p hath shewed strength with his arm; he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
He*p hath put down the mighty from their seats, and exalted them of low degree.
He*p hath filled the hungry with good things; and the rich he hath sent empty away.
He*p hath holpen his servant Israel, in remembrance of his mercy;
As*p he spake to our fathers, to Abraham, and to his seed for ever.
And*p Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.
Now*p Elisabeth's full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.
And*p her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.
And*p it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child; and they called him Zacharias, after the name of his father.
And*p his mother answered and said, Not so; but he shall be called John.
And*p they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.
And*p they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.
And*p he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marvelled all.
And*p his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue loosed, and he spake, and praised God.
And*p fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these sayings were noised abroad throughout all the hill country of Judaea.
And*p all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, What manner of child shall this be! And the hand of the Lord was with him.
And*p his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,
Blessed*p be the Lord God of Israel; for he hath visited and redeemed his people,
And*p hath raised up an horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David;
As*p he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:
That*p we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;
To*p perform the mercy promised to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant;
The*p oath which he sware to our father Abraham,
That*p he would grant unto us, that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear,
In*p holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.
And*p thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest: for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;
To*p give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins,
Through*p the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,
To*p give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, to guide our feet into the way of peace.
And*p the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his shewing unto Israel.
Luke 2
And*p it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.
(And*p this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)
And*p all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.
And*p Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)
To*p be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.
And*p so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
And*p she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.
And*p there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
And,*p lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.
And*p the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.
For*p unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
And*p this shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.
And*p suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,
Glory*p to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.

And*p it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.
And*p they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.
And*p when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.
And*p all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
But*p Mary kept all these things, and pondered them in her heart.
And*p the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.
And*p when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
And*p when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord;
(As*p it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)
And*p to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
And,*p behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and the same man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.
And*p it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.
And*p he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,
Then*p took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,
Lord,*p now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:
For*p mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
Which*p thou hast prepared before the face of all people;
A*p light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.
And*p Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.
And*p Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;
(Yea,*p a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.
And*p there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;
And*p she was a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
And*p she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
And*p when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.
And*p the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
Now*p his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.
And*p when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.
And*p when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it.
But*p they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.
And*p when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.
And*p it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.
And*p all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.
And*p when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.
And*p he said unto them, How*r is*r it*r that*r ye*r sought*r me?*r wist*r ye*r not*r that*r I*r must*r be*r about*r my*r Father's*r business?*r
And*p they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.
And*p he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
And*p Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
Luke 3

Now*p in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,
Annas*p and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
And*p he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;
As*p it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
Every*p valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth;
And*p all flesh shall see the salvation of God.
Then*p said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Bring*p forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
And*p now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
And*p the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?
He*p answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.
Then*p came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?
And*p he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.
And*p the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse any falsely; and be content with your wages.
And*p as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;

John*p answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:
Whose*p fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.
And*p many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.
But*p Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip's wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
Added*p yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.
Now*p when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,
And*p the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.
And*p Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which was the son of Heli,
Which*p was the son of Matthat, which was the son of Levi, which was the son of Melchi, which was the son of Janna, which was the son of Joseph,
Which*p was the son of Mattathias, which was the son of Amos, which was the son of Naum, which was the son of Esli, which was the son of Nagge,
Which*p was the son of Maath, which was the son of Mattathias, which was the son of Semei, which was the son of Joseph, which was the son of Juda,
Which*p was the son of Joanna, which was the son of Rhesa, which was the son of Zorobabel, which was the son of Salathiel, which was the son of Neri,
Which*p was the son of Melchi, which was the son of Addi, which was the son of Cosam, which was the son of Elmodam, which was the son of Er,
Which*p was the son of Jose, which was the son of Eliezer, which was the son of Jorim, which was the son of Matthat, which was the son of Levi,
Which*p was the son of Simeon, which was the son of Juda, which was the son of Joseph, which was the son of Jonan, which was the son of Eliakim,
Which*p was the son of Melea, which was the son of Menan, which was the son of Mattatha, which was the son of Nathan, which was the son of David,
Which*p was the son of Jesse, which was the son of Obed, which was the son of Booz, which was the son of Salmon, which was the son of Naasson,
Which*p was the son of Aminadab, which was the son of Aram, which was the son of Esrom, which was the son of Phares, which was the son of Judah,
Which*p was the son of Jacob, which was the son of Isaac, which was the son of Abraham, which was the son of Thara, which was the son of Nachor,
Which*p was the son of Saruch, which was the son of Ragau, which was the son of Phalec, which was the son of Heber, which was the son of Sala,
Which*p was the son of Cainan, which was the son of Arphaxad, which was the son of Sem, which was the son of Noah, which was the son of Lamech,
Which*p was the son of Mathusala, which was the son of Enoch, which was the son of Jared, which was the son of Maleleel, which was the son of Cainan,
Which*p was the son of Enos, which was the son of Seth, which was the son of Adam, which was the son of God.
Luke 4
And*p Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
Being*p forty days tempted of the devil. And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.
And*p the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.
And*p Jesus answered him, saying, It*r is*r written,*r That*r man*r shall*r not*r live*r by*r bread*r alone,*r but*r by*r every*r word*r of*r God.*r
And*p the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
And*p the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.
If*p thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.
And*p Jesus answered and said unto him, Get*r thee*r behind*r me,*r Satan:*r for*r it*r is*r written,*r Thou*r shalt*r worship*r the*r Lord*r thy*r God,*r and*r him*r only*r shalt*r thou*r serve.*r
And*p he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:
For*p it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:
And*p in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
And*p Jesus answering said unto him, It*r is*r said,*r Thou*r shalt*r not*r tempt*r the*r Lord*r thy*r God.*r
And*p when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.
And*p Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.
And*p he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.
And*p he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.
And*p there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias. And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,

The*rp Spirit*r of*r the*r Lord*r is*r upon*r me,*r because*r he*r hath*r anointed*r me*r to*r preach*r the*r gospel*r to*r the*r poor;*r he*r hath*r sent*r me*r to*r heal*r the*r brokenhearted,*r to*r preach*r deliverance*r to*r the*r captives,*r and*r recovering*r of*r sight*r to*r the*r blind,*r to*r set*r at*r liberty*r them*r that*r are*r bruised,*r
To*rp preach*r the*r acceptable*r year*r of*r the*r Lord.*r
And*p he closed the book, and he gave it again to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.
And*p he began to say unto them, This*r day*r is*r this*r scripture*r fulfilled*r in*r your*r ears.*r
And*p all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this Joseph's son?

And*p he said unto them, Ye*r will*r surely*r say*r unto*r me*r this*r proverb,*r Physician,*r heal*r thyself:*r whatsoever*r we*r have*r heard*r done*r in*r Capernaum,*r do*r also*r here*r in*r thy*r country.*r
And*p he said, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r No*r prophet*r is*r accepted*r in*r his*r own*r country.*r

But*rp I*r tell*r you*r of*r a*r truth,*r many*r widows*r were*r in*r Israel*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Elias,*r when*r the*r heaven*r was*r shut*r up*r three*r years*r and*r six*r months,*r when*r great*r famine*r was*r throughout*r all*r the*r land;*r
But*rp unto*r none*r of*r them*r was*r Elias*r sent,*r save*r unto*r Sarepta,*r a*r city*r of*r Sidon,*r unto*r a*r woman*r that*r was*r a*r widow.*r
And*rp many*r lepers*r were*r in*r Israel*r in*r the*r time*r of*r Eliseus*r the*r prophet;*r and*r none*r of*r them*r was*r cleansed,*r saving*r Naaman*r the*r Syrian.*r
And*p all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
And*p rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.
But*p he passing through the midst of them went his way,
And*p came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.
And*p they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.
And*p in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,
Saying,*p Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.
And*p Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold*r thy*r peace,*r and*r come*r out*r of*r him.*r And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.
And*p they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a word is this! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.
And*p the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.
And*p he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon's house. And Simon's wife's mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.
And*p he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.
Now*p when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
And*p devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God. And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.
And*p when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.
And*p he said unto them, I*r must*r preach*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r to*r other*r cities*r also:*r for*r therefore*r am*r I*r sent.*r
And*p he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.
Luke 5
And*p it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,
And*p saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
And*p he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon's, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.
Now*p when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch*r out*r into*r the*r deep,*r and*r let*r down*r your*r nets*r for*r a*r draught.*r
And*p Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.
And*p when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.
And*p they beckoned unto their partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.
When*p Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.
For*p he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:
And*p so was also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear*r not;*r from*r henceforth*r thou*r shalt*r catch*r men.*r
And*p when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.
And*p it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
And*p he put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I*r will:*r be*r thou*r clean.*r And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

And*p he charged him to tell no man: but*r go,*r and*r shew*r thyself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r for*r thy*r cleansing,*r according*r as*r Moses*r commanded,*r for*r a*r testimony*r unto*r them.*r
But*p so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
And*p he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

And*p it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was present to heal them.
And,*p behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought means to bring him in, and to lay him before him.

And*p when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus.
And*p when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man,*r thy*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r thee.*r
And*p the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?
But*p when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What*r reason*r ye*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
